pathogen.name: E. coli
pathogen.description: A coliform, rod-shaped bacterium, Escherichia coli are commonly found in the gut.
pathogen.hint: Many strains of E. coli are part of the gut's normal microbiota. It's probably okay to ignore it.

pathogen.name: Salmonella
pathogen.description: A capsular bacterium that uses its many flagella to travel from place to place, Salmonella targets the stomach.
pathogen.hint: It looks like this pathogen is able to produce energy regardless of its surroundings. Perhaps a general attack can do the trick.

pathogen.name: C. difficile
pathogen.description: Clostridiodes difficile, a motile, drumstick-shaped bacteria.
pathogen.hint: C. difficile is spore-forming. Better not take too long fighting it.
